name: Midnight
reason: it's called Midnight

name: 3am
reason: it's called 3am

name: dont say a word
reason: the drums are very chill and sleepy

name: Seen You
reason: it's a very relaxing song. Perfect to just play and look out the window and think about life.

name: Her
reason: the drums are a little heavy. Vocals certainly possess a Midnight quality

name: controlla
reason: of the low-key drums and relaxing piano tunes

name: Le Sud
reason: guitars are almost exclusively limited to Midnight. It's close to 3AM though

name: Motionless Thoughts
reason: very relaxing. Sounds of the sea, chill piano. Nothing heavy

name: Things Work out Eventually
reason: despite the chilled nature of the song, it still gives a feeling of wanting to get things done - the day isn't over yet

name: Nowhere Else
reason: while the drums are more muted than your average Midnight song, it still feels busy enough to keep it away from a 3AM listen

name: Damn Fine Coffee
reason: the brass makes this undoubtably a Midnight song

name: 5:32pm
reason: despite the reasonably chilled melody, the drums make it clear there is still many more hours in the night to come

name: cozy winter
reason: picture this: it's been a long day. It's Midnight, but you don't feel like sleeping. You make a cup of tea or maybe even some coffee and see what's on Netflix.

name: She Passed Away Alone at Sea
reason: picture this: you wake up and realise it's 3AM. You look out the window to see the lights. Or perhaps you look out into the fields and wonder if there's anyone out there.

name: Long Espresso
artist: o k h o and Saito
reason: anything that mentions coffee is almost a guarenteed Midnight-er. The synth gives off some kind of funky energy

name: Again
reason: the drums have a moderate amount of energy. Vocals are a good sign of a Midnight-er

name: Matt
reason: the drums may be heavy but they are also slow. A song where you think about life, but not too hard

name: Sleepyface
reason: there's lots going on here makes it a pretty clear Midnight-er. Great bass

name: Small Little Green Cubes
reason: it can be quite loud, but the buildup prepares you for it

name: This Isn't You
reason: there's nothing too heavy here. Just a very relaxing song

name: Getsomerest/sleepwell
reason: there's brass, heavy-ish drums and vocals. All characteristics of a Midnight song

name: Stay the Same
reason: there's a lot going on, but it certainly could be a 3AM song under a different opinion

name: Boys' Bop
reason: there would be too much energy if it was a 3AM song

name: Plswaveback
reason: the synth definitely pushes it into Midnight territory

name: I Wish I Could Sleep
reason: despite how busy it is, it just feels like a song that would be played at 3AM, y'know? It's all opinion though, so give yourself a point if you chose Midnight

name: Nostos
reason: it does get loud, but there's a buildup and that buildup is perfect for 3AM listening

name: Don't Know How to Say This to You
reason: guitars are usually off-limits for 3AM listening, but this one feels quite pure and relaxing

name: Beyond Dazed
reason: of the strong drums, but still perfect for listening while thinking about what it all means.

name: Suzhou
reason: it's one of the more lively songs on the list. It's more of a 'it's just turned midnight and I've still got 7 pages to go on this essay' song

name: My Take on Solidao.
reason: no matter how bad it is. No matter how bad you're feeling. Everything will be okay

name: The Cave//Wexas
reason: you're not listening to this song unless there's something to do.

name: Introduction to the Snow
reason: as the clock strikes Midnight, you look out the window and notice it's started snowing. You gaze upon the streets and watch the droplets fall

name: He^rt
reason: there's a fast tempo and some neat drums
